alert.note: Alert for Kanawha; Putnam (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:31PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kanawha and central Putnam Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 430 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Teays Valley, or near Nitro, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Winfield, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Sissonville, Eleanor, Poca, Cross Lanes, Institute, Tornado, Teays Valley, Bancroft and Liberty. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 38 and 57. Route 119 between mile markers 75 and 79. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
